list_definition.definition: the place where something real or imaginary happens

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A murderer sometimes revisits the scene of his crime
The scene of this opera is laid/set in Switzerland.

list_definition.definition: an incident etc which is seen or remembered

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He recalled scenes from his childhood.
I was very angry but I didn’t want to make a scene.

list_definition.definition: a view of a landscape etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The sheep grazing on the hillside made a peaceful scene.

list_definition.mean_english: đoạn, hồi, cảnh (của một vở kịch)
list_definition.definition: one part or division of a play etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The hero died in the first scene of the third act of the play.

list_definition.definition: the setting or background for a play etc
